file_content.text: You have faced the trials, outsider.
But the Wellspring is for the broken.
I came a long way to consult with your masters.
Excuse me?
Another outsider came here, once. I have questions about him.
I need information.
After what I went through, you want to stop me now?
Don't you dare kick me out!
The Mystics tend the Wellspring. The Mystics make bodies and minds whole. I disturb them for nothing less.
I'm betting the Mystics won't let a woman die on their doorstep.
I'm suffering from disease!
I'm betting the Mystics won't let a man die on their doorstep.
I'm suffering from disease!
I may be an outsider, but I need guidance. There are terrible things in my past... I sometimes wonder who I am.
My spirit is hurt.
I will take you to Amin-Le.
You must do this alone.
Drag this out, see if you can figure what the Shining Man went through. I'll try to find their records or something....
Bas-Ton suggested patience. You're walking the path of the Shining Man... see where it goes.
If the Shining Man was here, he might've gone through the same thing. See where it goes?
The Shining Man was "made whole" here, too. Maybe it's best to retrace his steps.
Will you survive what the Shining Man survived?
The fracture is deep.
To rebuild a body, a spirit, one rebuilds history.
The vitalicron is the vessel of memory. Each petitioner fills. In a vitalicron, the ceremony is preserved.
I'm honored, Mystic of the shrine.
Thank you.
These vitalicrons remember everyone who comes here?
You mean rituals get recorded?
Yes. Breathe the mists and speak true.
I have a question for you--about one of your previous "petitioners."
I didn't come for healing.
My purpose is healing. Breathe the mists and speak true.
You are the tree. Your roots, the past. The universe is soil.
The tree is sick. See what nurtures the roots, and remember a homeworld of ice. A proud people, never trusting... who were you then?
I was part of the secret police. When Intelligence made an offer... to protect Csilla meant protecting the Empire.
I was a proud Chiss servant.
I knew the Empire disdained non-humans. I thought I would be the exception.
A naive alien among humans.
Perhaps you were, at times.
The tree is sick. See what nurtures the roots, and remember shedding blood in return for comfort. Your keepers reshaped you... who were you then?
Imperial Intelligence found me, "polished" me. Said it was a chance to be more.
I was an alien on the streets.
I killed people. Decisions were simpler at the time.
Someone living a simpler life.
So it is as we age.
The tree is sick. See what nurtures the roots, and remember your early teachings. A uniform, before it became a mask... who were you then?
I don't know what you're talking about. What's happening to me?
What's going on?
This is healing. This is life. Focus beyond the words.
I wanted to serve the Empire and all its worlds. Joining Imperial Intelligence was a natural step.
I started out a patriot.
The military was the path to power. I'd never be a Sith, but a Moff...?
An ambitious child.
You found power nonetheless.
Consider now the seasons that shaped the tree.
First a season of fire. You saw the world burn. You kindled spark into the blaze. You... bound yourself to a darkness falling like rain.
First a season of fire. You purged a darkness by kindling the blaze. Many screamed, but you did what no other could.
First a season of fire. You stamped out a spark. You could not purge the darkness; none but you could have tried.
Then a season of famine. You stood alone; your friends and foes carved the wood of your mind. Speak of the wound. Speak of your strength.
No matter how many lies I live, I do fight for a reason. My strength is there.
My cause gives me strength.
Only if you truly understand.
Both sides treated me like a puppet. It all started to seem pointless.
I've lost my purpose.
It doesn't matter what I suffered or how I survived. What matters is that I'm alive now.
That's a stupid question.
Now you are in a season of mists. All things are obscured.
Your spirit shines, but it is trapped. You must change; what will you become?
Your spirit burns angry like frost, but this cannot endure forever. You must change; what will you become?
Your spirit seeks balance while the world crumbles beneath you. You must change, but what will you become?
No more control. No more orders. I want to choose my own fate.
I want to be free.
Then you are truly healed.
Changing identities is what I do best. I'll be whatever I need to be.
I can be anyone I like.
Then only you will know when you are truly healed.
I don't need to change. And I've heard enough.
This is insane.
Then I have put you on the path, but I cannot heal you.
The honored one, Amin-Le, has spoken.
The healing has been recorded. You hold a vitalicron--the memory of your wholeness, technologically stored. It must go to our vaults.
Say I wanted to view one of these vitalicrons...
How do the recordings work?
I can't let this fall into the wrong hands.
What went on was private.
Your Mystic and I still have business.
I wasn't through with Amin-Le.
Amin-Le must rest. She will speak of the healing to no one.
Each vitalicron is genetically locked. Only its creator may know what happened.
Ten thousand and more are stored in the vault. Honor us by placing yours within.
Sometimes, it's almost too easy. Shining Man records, here we come.
The Shining Man's path continues. If he was healed, he went to the vault as well.
Want to see what the Shining Man left for us?
So much easier when they open the vault doors for you.
Megasecurity Ward 23 went centuries without an intruder. This vault is too easy.
Maybe I wasn't clear.
Big mistake. [Threaten him]
Tell me about the Shining Man's visit to the Wellspring, or even the Mystics won't be able to heal you.
You two chat. I'll watch the doors.
If word of this gets out...
This is our best behavior?
I can't blame you for running out of patience. But....
I will stop any witnesses.
I know the Shining Man. I did not know he came here.
The Mystics never speak of past work. Wellspring history is preserved in the vitalicrons--memory of each petitioner, technologically stored.
The Shining Man had one too?
Give me access.
Yes. I will show you.
You're doing well. Cooperate, and I'll be gone soon.
Don't be scared.
You do not... my service is right.
Vows can be broken. Who do I interrogate first?
I can make the Mystics talk.
You will not. Unless you torment every one, throw away Imperial treaties, you will not.
I will take you to the vitalicrons.
Each, genetically locked by the petitioner who created it; only its creator may examine the past. I know nothing else.
Try not to miss me when you wake up.
Good work. [Knock him out]
I don't have a quarrel with you or your masters. Go.
You can leave now.
I'm glad you let him live. Let's find the vitalicron.
He'll cause trouble later on--but I suppose you know that. Let's find the vitalicron.
You made him your enemy but declined to end him. An unfortunate decision.
Thank you for your time.
We're finished. [Kill him]
Let's find the vitalicron and get out before the Mystics hear....
This won't endear you to our superiors or the Voss. And we also admit to finding it distasteful.
However, we should concentrate on finding the vitalicron.
I... wouldn't have thought that necessary, sir. But I suppose he can't tell anyone, now.
It'll take them some time to find the body. Let's make use of it.
You resort to murder so quickly. It would be easy to manipulate that instinct.
This is the Wellspring of the Shrine of Healing. If you have no place here, turn away.
Don't be stupid....
This isn't the way.
Quite a bet.
I'm sure we can--don't!
Excellent.
No...
Bring her! Find Amin-Le!
Bring him! Find Amin-Le!
Wounds, deep; shattered flesh, shattered mind. Leave us.
Listen, outsider.
The vitalicron is the vessel of memory. Every petitioner fills. In a vitalicron, history mends, and this ceremony is preserved.
You're a Mystic? And you're healing me?
Who are you?
I guide. You must speak truth.
These vitalicrons--everyone who comes here fills one?
You mean rituals get recorded?
Everyone. You will speak truth.
I need to know about the Shining Man.
I have questions, please!
All outsiders are petitioners. Listen and speak truth.
